Posts.Content: Apr 4, 2012 07:43PM nfranklin wrote: Finally got word from my Dr. I will be starting my chemotherapy treatments on Monday 4/9, T-FAC. Kind of scared but I have lots of support and I am leaning on God. I will be preparing my chemo bag this weekend, based on a list I found on this site.

Posts.Content: Apr 7, 2012 08:56AM nfranklin wrote: Going to visit my younger son and the grands today, that should be fun. He has 3 girls 19, 14, and 11 (this month). Kim you have a blessed day. Happy Easter everyone.
Posts.Title: March/April Chemo T/C x 4 Catherine22 Summer51

Posts.Content: Sep 17, 2012 10:13PM nfranklin wrote: I agree we need to keep this thread at the top, biotene was a life saver for my mouth. Had sore mouth once but that was due to me trying to eat spicy food, not very smart, but biotene cleared it up quickly. Tomorrow is my last chemo treatment which is the F booster, thank you Lord. Now, when will I be rid of black nails both hands and feet, motley looking hand and feet, I want hair, eyebrows, and eyelashes, most of all I just want to feel better and not be so tired all the time. I start radiation next month, not really complaining but I really do think I see a light at the end of this tunnel, and it is not a train :). I love life...
Posts.Title: More Tips (and a Shopping List) for Getting Through Chemo rock MinusTwo

Posts.Content: Apr 6, 2012 11:16PM - edited Apr 6, 2012 11:18PM by nfranklin Slak & onvacation: I, like both of you have not told very many people, I told someone and the look on their face was pity and the words she said did not make feel encouraged. She said "oh you poor thing, that is too bad, I am sorry this happen to you" , not one word of encouragement. But I have to say that most of the people that I have decided to tell are very encouraging, most say "you can beat this, I am praying for you" that is really uplifting. Some people just don't known what to said or how to react. Thank you ladies for all the information and encouragement. My first Taxon treatment is Monday at 5:30 pm. I need to shop for my chemotherapy bag, a list I found on this site. A social worker at MDA told me that most people work through Taxol, I'm retired and did work part-time, currently on leave, we will see what all this brings.
Posts.Title: March/April Chemo T/C x 4 Catherine22 Summer51

Posts.Content: Apr 17, 2012 08:42PM nfranklin wrote: This morning was good full of energy no other apparent SE's. Could not eat or drink anything before fasting blood specimen at 12:45 today at the hospital. Took fruit, nuts, and oat bar and juice to eat after blood is taken. Had bone density test no pain at all 1:30pm, one of the easiest test. Visited with my MO 4pm, discussed the port. I really have only one good vein and they have had to stick me twice each time to put the IV in, he said that was not good so we are talking about the port sooner than later. Came home sneezing and with a runny nose, around 4:30 pm after sitting in a cold waiting room, and oh so tired again, all my energy is GONE, used up in the waiting room of the hospital. I am hoping for energy in the morning, I want to go grocery shopping, so my DH will not have to, even though he doesn't mind at all, but I like to grocery shop sometimes, it's been almost 2 months since I got to grocery shop all on my own. I am ready for bed can hardly keep my eyes open, don't want to go to bed too early, because I will probably wake up in the wee wee hours of the morning and can't go back to sleep. Have a good night every one.
Posts.Title: March/April Chemo T/C x 4 Catherine22 Summer51
